icon.description:
Icon is a path to the icon file relative to Root. It will be converted to needed formats via imagemagick,
so for psd files you can use icon.psd[0] to convert all layers

race.description: Enable data race detection (supported only on amd64)

tags.description: List of build tags to consider satisfied during the build

ldflags.description: Arguments to pass on each go tool link invocation

mode.description: Indicates which kind of object file to build

vcs.description: Whether to stamp binaries with version control information

trimpath.description: Remove all file system paths from the resulting executable

common.description: Common will be used as defaults for all architectures

out_dir.description:
OutDir is a path relative to Config.DistDir where the final artifacts will be placed
If not set, "linux_[arch]" will be used

build_bin.description:
Defines if binary should be built
If empty, the binary will be created only if it's needed for deb package

build_deb.description:
Defines if deb package should be built
If empty, the deb package will not be created

product_name.description:
ProductName is a human-readable name of the product. Is used in MacOS app bundle, dmg and Windows manifest
If not set, the last part of module name will be used

version.description:
Version is a version of the app. It's used in MacOS app bundle and Windows manifest
If not set, "1.0.0" will be used

identifier.description:
Identifier is a unique identifier for the app (used in MacOS bundle plist and Windows manifest),
usually in reverse domain notation e.g. com.example.myapp
If not set, the reversed module name will be used

copyright.description:
Copyright is a copyright string (used in MacOS bundle plist and deb package)
If not set, the "© [current_year], [identifier without the last part]" will be used

high_dpi.description: HighDpi is a flag to enable high dpi support on Windows and MacOS

bin_name.description:
The name of the resulting binary file. For Windows '.exe' extension will be added automatically
If not set, the last part of the main package path will be used

deb.description: Deb is a config for deb package

deb_name.description:
Name of the resulting deb package file relative to arch `out_dir`
If empty, [common.product_name].deb will be used

custom_nfpm_config.description:
Path to custom nfpm config relative to the root.
If set, all other fields will be ignored and nfpm will be used with this config
and "XGO_PACK_" env variables that can be used in config fields as placeholders:
${XGO_PACK_DASHED_PRODUCT_NAME}, ${XGO_PACK_ARCH}, ${XGO_PACK_VERSION}

name.description:
If empty, common.ProductName will be used.
For allowed format see https://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-controlfields.html#s-f-source
The string will be lower-cased and not supported symbols will be replaced with '-'

maintainer.description: Recommended to be filled. If empty common.identifier without last part will be used

contents.description: Additional files to include to the package (local path -> destination abs path)

dst_bin_path.description:
Destination path for bin file in the package (as absolute path in the dest system)
If empty, "/usr/bin/{common.bin_name}" will be used

add_desktop_entry.description:
Defines if desktop entry should be added to the package
If empty, `true` will be used

add_icon.description:
Defines if icon should be added to the package
If empty, `true` will be used (only if add_desktop_entry is true)

name.description:
Desktop entry name.
If empty, common.product_name will be used

type.description: Desktop entry type. If empty, "Application" will be used

terminal.description:
Desktop entry Terminal key.
If empty, `true` will be used

no_display.description:
Desktop entry NoDisplay key.
If empty, `false` will be used

common.description: Will be used as defaults for all architectures

out_dir.description:
OutDir is a path relative to Config.DistDir where the final artifacts will be placed
If not set, "macos_[arch]" will be used

build_bin.description:
Defines if binary should be built.
If false, the binary will be built only in case it's required to build bundle or dmg.
Temporary path will be used in this case.

build_bundle.description:
Defines if app bundle should be built.
If false, the bundle will be created only in case it's required to build dmg.
Temporary path will be used in this case.

build_dmg.description:
Defines if dmg should be built.
If empty, the dmg will not be created

bundle_name.description:

hide_in_dock.description: HideInDock sets the plist flag in the app bundle to hide the app in dock

TargetMacosCommonBundle.description: TargetMacosCommonBundle is an arches common settings for MacOS bundle

dmg_name.description:
DmgName is a name of the resulting dmg file relative to TargetMacosArch.OutDir.
If empty, "[targets.common.product_name].dmg" will be used

add_applications_symlink.description:
AddApplicationsSymlink is a flag to add a symlink to the /Applications folder in the dmg
If not set, true will be used

TargetMacosCommonDmg.description: TargetMacosCommonDmg is an arches common settings for MacOS dmg

build_syso.description:

If false, the .syso file will be built only in case it's required to build binary

presets.description:
Presets is a preset config names list that will be used as a base for the config.
Presets will be applied in the order of appearance in the list, so the last one will override the previous ones.

root.description: Root path of the project. Absolute or relative to working directory.

dist_dir.description:
DistDir is path (relative to root) of a directory for final build artifacts.
If not set, "dist" dir will be used

tmp_dir.description:
TmpDir is path (relative to root) of a temp directory for temporary build artifacts. If not set, a temporary
directory will be created in DistDir

src.description: Src sets paths of source files and an icon

xgo.description: XGoConfig is a config for xgo tool
